text: You basically want to ban all cars and force everyone to walk.
label: strawman

text: Your argument implies that the government should control every aspect of our lives.
label: strawman

text: So what you mean is that no one should ever be allowed to have fun.
label: strawman

text: You’re exaggerating by suggesting we need a complete overhaul.
label: strawman

text: If I understand correctly, you want to eliminate all taxes completely.
label: strawman

text: So your plan is to give free money to everyone, which will obviously crash the economy.
label: strawman

text: Basically, you’re arguing that every law should be ignored.
label: strawman

text: You’re claiming that if one rule changes, society must collapse.
label: strawman

text: So you think no one should ever disagree with you?
label: strawman

text: Your point is basically that education should be banned entirely.
label: strawman

text: So, in your view, we should just abandon all healthcare regulations.
label: strawman

text: You’re suggesting that any form of oversight is tyranny.
label: strawman

text: So what you’re really saying is that all employees should get unlimited vacation?
label: strawman

text: Basically, you think the police should do nothing ever.
label: strawman

text: So your argument is that nobody should pay taxes?
label: strawman

text: Your claim implies that every citizen must vote identically.
label: strawman

text: So, according to you, all schools should be shut down?
label: strawman

text: You’re exaggerating to suggest the world will end if we do X.
label: strawman

text: So what you’re arguing is an extreme version nobody actually proposed.
label: strawman
